website_summaries.verdict: In spite of occasional mechanical complaints, a good cable lock for securing a bike. Beware that this lock is not 100% theft-proof, though.
pros: 4-ft cable is adequate for a number of different locking configurations
Users found the mounting bracket sturdy, holding up to bumpy rides
cons: Mounting attachment doesn’t fit all frames
A few issues reported with lock mechanism
As with most locks, not completely theft-proof

customer_reviews.title: Avoid! Won't stop thieves!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bike lock for giving a thief a nice chuckle as they cut through it easily. What a nice way to start off your weekend. Finding out that you won't be biking to work as your bike has been stolen and this POS lock did nothing to stop the thief.
customer_reviews.author: George Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Mounting bracket poorly constructed - Customer Service Sent a Newly designed clamp.
customer_reviews.text: The cable-lock seems to be OK but the carrier bracket supplied with it is poorly designed and constructed. It is very weak plastic as soon as I began to tighten the clamp screws the corner of the bracket snapped off. The third photo is of the redesigned bracket sent to me from the company's customer service. Since I had already made my own bracket I have not used the one sent to me but it does appear to be a stronger design than the original one that broke while installing it. I will say their customer service is responsive which is appreciated. Due to their great service I have bumped my original review from 3 stars to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: bobwinder

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend; broke in half.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this from UShake (noticed the company name on this page changed), and although it could have likley been cut, I was okay with it. Granted, when it was cold it was difficult to bend. Also, one side of the plastic lock came apart and did reveal a spot of the wire not covered, so easier to cut, but I simply clicked the plastic piece back into place. However, yesterday, I was going to unlock it, and it simply broke in half! I was a bit stunned. Anyway, based on these fault, I can't recommend this product or any like it based on my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Great lock!
customer_reviews.text: Great lock and it's pretty long so you have many options on how to lock it. You also set the code yourself so you can use something you know you'll remember. Also, I was skeptical about the holder that it came with and that it might fall off and I wouldn't notice it but after some pretty bumpy rides I haven't had any problems!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Build Quality and strong lock with easy mechanisms as well as great feeling keys
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lock Study build quality I was quite surprised by how heavy it was initially. The dials are extremely tactile and feel incredibly smooth while transitioning from digit to digit A long and strong band, very helpful to park and lock your bike in places you might not be able to with a U Shaped lock. The mount is easy to install and used a standard star head screw driver.
customer_reviews.author: Deep1499

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for not only a bicycle but also securing a chain link fence gate
customer_reviews.text: After discovering that someone during the night opened the chain link gate to my back yard and leaving it open, my dog got out. Fortunately a neighbor called me and I retrieved him. We have had a series of car break ins lately in our development so I suspect someone was thinking of coming in through my back yard patio, but my little Schnauzer "Miles" must have barked and ran them off. So I bought this rather than a pad lock and chain because I hate keeping track of keys. It is very simple to program for your personal 4 digit code and appears sturdy enough to resist compromising except for heavy duty bolt cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Ted A. Mcelroy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, log wire and configurable lock number
customer_reviews.text: Lock wire is very sturdy and pretty long, so it is easy to lock bike on any kind of bike stand. Lock number is configurable so you can provide something of your own. I like it and will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dhananjay

customer_reviews.title: Best bike lock you can get
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few weeks now. It's a great lock and works well. Easy and smoothe to move the numbers, and easy to unlock with the right password. It's a great price for a great bike lock. Very pleased with this product. It comes with a piece that allows you to screw it onto your bike and you can attach and detach the bike lock. I personally didn't use it cause it doesn't look pretty on my bike haha and I can just put it in my bike basket as I rode my bike or wrap it around the body of the bike and lock it.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe D.

customer_reviews.title: Overall Wonderful! But A Tip-May Not Fit With Your Rear Bike Light!
customer_reviews.text: Never been so happy with a bike lock. Super easy to install on the bike and to set the lock. It took less than ten minutes to get it up and going. I love how simply it glides in/out of the secured mounting bracket. Feels quality! Of note, if you have a rear flashing bike light as many do, **it probably won't fit in addition to this mounting lock.** I found this out the hard way...I had to order a horizontal, smaller bike light because this lock/mounting bracket takes up most of the pole directly beneath your bike seat. Also think about this if you carry a pack in that spot. Still giving it 5 stars because it's wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Proper Bostonian

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this prior to a trip to Italy. We were taking the train there between cities and other travelers recommend securing our luggage to luggage racks to prevent bags from being stolen from the train. I purchased this bike lock for this purpose. It is strong and well made with a secure lock. The lock opens and closes based on a number code which I was able to set easily. We were able to store it easily, flat in our suitcases when not in use and it served it's purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: My kid love it on the bike to secure when ridding out
customer_reviews.text: My kid love it on the bike to secure when ridding out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BIKE WAS STOLEN!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed by this product. I live in SF where bike theft is not uncommon, however I expect locks to ...well... lock the bike. Unfortunately, this lock did not do that and my bike was stolen. I repurchased the bike but i will not be repurchasing this "lock". I am surprised by all the positive reviews, this may be because the product looks as it does in the photos, shipped on time, and is easy to use. It may even deter thieves because it looks and feels like a lock. However, I can't bring myself to give a product more than one star if it doesn't do what it was purchased to do. I really wish this product worked! :(
customer_reviews.author: diane tamir

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's light, easy to use, but not secure at all. There is critical design fault on the locking part, easily got cut. My bike was already stolen, and the thief left the cut lock there. If you are tired of your bike, want a new one and have phycological difficulty throwing your bike to trash, this lock is a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Only for show.
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy this you must understand that this thing is JUST for show. JUST for show, ONLY for show, it will NOT protect your bike. 2 days and a scrawny thief snipped through these things with garden shears-- all on camera. Don't even waste your money... lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A simple, low-cost (and low security) lock solution
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, easy setup, simple, low-cost (and low-security) solution. Setting up the 4-digit code was very easy. The seat-cable mount works well with a click-in lock, would have been nice if it was made out of metal instead of plastic though, I can see this mount breaking in relatively short time. The cable itself works well, not sure how easy it is to cut through, it looks like simple wire-cutters could get through, but I have not tested it. If I lived in a more un-trusting environment or had a more expensive bicycle, I would definitely look into a thicker gauge cable or a metal-U lock.
customer_reviews.author: Woody W.

customer_reviews.title: A fine lock for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This bike lock works like it should but the price does reflect its quality and does feel cheap. I’m not sure how it will hold up if it’s security was tested. But fine for basic security.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Compact with decent lock for areas that aren't high-crime
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these locks to lock up my bike after my daily commute at the train station. I've mounted both of them on my bike frame where they sit compactly. The combination dial has large numbers so you can see them pretty easily and the lock seems fairly strong (quite frankly if I left my bike in less secure areas I'd want a much stronger lock) and the cable is thick enough to resist cutting under normal circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: K.Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Not useful in big city
customer_reviews.text: Bike was stolen. They cut through the cable twice and rode off with my bike. It's really not worth your money if you live in an area where people may actually try and steal your bike. Really disappointed and sad that a thief has my new bike.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: STINKS. Literally.
customer_reviews.text: This lock/cable has the most disgusting chemical and mothball smell, AND IT GETS ON YOUR HANDS WHEN YOU TOUCH IT!!! BEWARE!!! I’m keeping mine outside to see if the smell will dissipate. But it’s so strong I am doubtful. It will probably have to end up in the dumpster, and I will purchase a different one. Unbelievable that someone would sell this product, and not expect 1-star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: InteractiveLogic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Lock & Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: The product is very good. It does exactly what it says and does it well...very easy to set or change the lock code, and easy to mount to the bike frame using the provided bracket. However, what was really great was the customer service. I had a shipping problem of my own doing and UShake was very responsive and helpful, and I was able to resolve my issue with a short call to Amazon using the info UShake customer service provided. I must also add that Amazon support was great too!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I love to bike to as many places as a can such as the pharamacy or even work so this works great
customer_reviews.author: SerenaG

customer_reviews.title: Dont Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These bike locks arnt very useful. The lock on mine broke very easily and wouldn't let me turn the numbers to unlock it so I had to cut the chain with a wire cutter to get my bike. Took me about 5-10 minutes to break through. I don't recommend getting these types of bike locks at all. A real chain and a lock would do better or perhaps a U shaped lock.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy S.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic part broke after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in November 2017. Everything was going great, until the plastic piece that holds the lock to the bike frame snapped. The screws are still in place, but the plastic snapped. In short, the lock itself is still usable, but will no longer attach to the bike. And it's rather heavy to lug in a backpack. This happened in April 2018. ///Edited at the end of April 2018- UShake sent me a new lock and connector piece. I've changed the review to 5 stars as I appreciate being sent another lock and connector piece to replace the one that broke.
customer_reviews.author: Yelske

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, Maynard!
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this review by saying I commute to work in a very safe midwestern city and park my bike within view of at least 4 coworkers. That said, I looked for a cable bike lock that would be easy to use and help keep semi-honest kids honest. Do I think this cable will stymie a determined and experienced bike thief? No. Do I think it will keep a dumb kid from boosting my bike? Absolutely! The lock is easy to set, the length is right for the bike stands in my city, the carry clip is ingenious and holds the cable firmly while I ride. Quality workmanship at an excellent price point. Good stuff, Maynard!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Dials locked together after being used outside for about six weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2016 and only used it to to lock my kayaks on top of the car when traveling.That means they've been used maybe six times for a week each outdoors. Last time, the dials 'froze' together after working fine a few days earlier so they couldn't be turned. I had visions of having to cut this 1/2" cable off but using a slip-joint pliers to hold one dial while using another to move the adjacent dial, was able to get it off. Since then, the dials have a very hard, rough feel when turned, which was smooth before, so I don't trust it. Perhaps they're not meant to spend much time out in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Phlypp

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Update: the flimsy cable holder broke after about a year, but the cable lock still works flawless. I now keep the cable wrapped around the top bike bar now. Minus one star for the cheap holder. OLD original review from 2017: Although the holder seems pretty flimsy it has held up for the past 6 months of occassional use. I haven't ridden the bike off rode yet with this lock attached, but I have popped a fair share of curbs and a lot Baltimore City streets tend to be just as bumpy as off road anyway. The cable is also long enough to wrap around most objects, including lamp posts.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible lock. It feels like it is very low quality and cheaply made. I have great difficulty when I try to lock my bike up and sometimes it won't lock when I try to lock it, I have to hold it firmly in place then move the dials. The combination must be correct in order to lock it as well which is very annoying. I tried it too late so now I cannot return it. Probably going to throw it out and buy a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F.

customer_reviews.title: 8 year old finds it easy to use combination cable bike lock
customer_reviews.text: We got this bike lock for our 8 y.o. daughter, who often rides to school. She can easily remember the combination and open the lock herself. No keys to lose! When not in use, the cable just coils up and locks onto the bike shaft. Fortunately, we could put it where it won't interfere with her riding. The cable is just long enough for her bike without being too cumbersome. However, it may be too small for an adult sized bike. We would recommend this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Go_Fins!

customer_reviews.title: Great lock!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the lock overall. The mount works great, it's easy to set the combo, and easy to use. I (initially***) gave it 3 stars because it's just TOO SHORT. ***Update 11/5/2017: based on my review, UShake contacted me and sent me the longer 6-foot version of the lock. It was really unexpected and above and beyond. The extra length is perfect and I can now give the lock 5 stars. Just make sure you get the correct length for your application!
customer_reviews.author: RedAggie03

customer_reviews.title: Great bike lock, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well constructed lock and easy to use. It comes with a lock holder that you can put on your bike to conveniently carry your lock with you. I got the 4-foot cable and it is long enough to securely fasten my bike to most bike stations; however, you may need a longer cable depending on where you are leaving your bike. The cable, itself, is well covered with a smooth tube shielding the cable. You can easily set the 4-digit combination and change it if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED:  Great customer service - make sure the cable holder fits your bike
customer_reviews.text: Their customer service group contacted me and requested information on my installation. After reviewing the details, they concluded my bike was not designed for this cable holder and offered a full refund. I didn't even ask them - they proactively read my review. I've never experienced such a proactive policy. If I was just rating the customer service they would get 10 stars. The cable fell off the bike during the first ride. The holder has a clip which allows quick attachment of the cable. It sounds go in theory but the clip doesn't stay in place and the cable fell off. Make sure you have a good installation.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L Broughton

customer_reviews.title: This does not work and feels very cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions as well as customer tips and my lock does not work. I rotate the set knob, I enter my new code in, and rotate back. The lock may work once or twice, but when I try to lock it again, I can actually change the code without rotating the "set" knob. The whole thing feels very cheap and does not reliably work. I will be returning this product. Someone said the 1st wheel (on the left) gets stuck, in my case it looks like it doesn't even work.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set a combination and easy to use. I mostly need it to lock my bike up at the elementary school I work at. Needless to say there's not a lot of sketchy people hanging around an elementary school while school is in session. It does seem like a slightly tougher version of the lock we all grew up with. I don't know if I'd trust it if I were locking my bike up by an urban office building where no one pays attention but for my needs, it's better than expectations.
customer_reviews.author: DawnM54

customer_reviews.title: Its Worked Well in the past year
customer_reviews.text: about a year ago i bought an electric bike. kind of costly so i needed to keep it secure when i went to places, specially since its so easy to remove the battery. My friend had his lock for a while before me and recommended this brand, i can't be happier with the results, Ive never had an issue its never not locked or not opened, so far no one has stolen my bike so that's good. It really works well for me. i have zero complains. very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lucia Villa

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - AWFUL QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: My lock split apart unexpectedly, terrible quality! UPDATE - customer service was nice and sent me a new lock. You can contact customer service at support@titanker.com However, in the time that it took for the new lock to get to me, I bought a new titanker chain lock that I thought would be sturdier. I used that one and the lock was cut AGAIN, this time my bike was stolen! Titanker was nice enough to refund me for the second bike lock but still, my bike was stolen. I would STRONGLY suggest buying a u lock instead of any other kind of lock for your bike. DON'T BE CHEAP!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Shi

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few uses, then it just..didn't. I hooked up the bikes to my hitch rack, locked it up and drove to the trails. Got there, and the lock wouldnt come open. Never changed combo, nothing. Tried for 45 minutes and it wouldnt budge. Tried everything. Looked up ways to try and reset it, wouldnt work. Had to drive all the way back home and undo the hitch from my truck, as the bikes were still locked to it, and carry the entire thing to the garage. So my trustee hammer and flathead and about 30 minutes and it shattered in to pieces. Having to order a new one now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly I have a new combination that I didn't know about
customer_reviews.text: I set my combination and have been using it for months. Then I couldn't lock it. It was unlocked, so I used a flashlight to look inside the barrel and turned the numbers so I could close it. I have a new combination that I did not set. OK, well I can set it back to my old combination. Nope. I followed the directions turning the set dial and nothing. Now I don't trust this. Why would it change my combination like that?
customer_reviews.author: Melsie517

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock to replace a similar one I had owned and used for years. This one lasted about 2 days. The second day I went to unlock our bikes for a ride I couldn't get it to open. I checked and rechecked to make sure the combination I had set was lined up correctly, but it still would not open. Finally, I had to use force to get it to release. Then upon returning from the bike ride the lock refused to re-lock and I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl A. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bike Lock Cable!
customer_reviews.text: "I got this lock for the cruiser bike I purchased for my honey and she likes it. Four digit combination is better than three and the covering on the cable is good. She likes the length which allows both wheels to be secured around a pole. The connection bracket is a great idea and works fine. She set it up as soon as we got it. Fine product."
customer_reviews.author: Tyger

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work, tumblers don’t connect. Save yourself aggravation!
customer_reviews.text: 1 didnt work at all, tumblers didn’t connect. Returned it 1 (comes in pack of two) asking for it to be replaced, instead refunded full price. Few weeks later, rescinded refund...out money AND item because both weren’t returned.. 🤔 Poor quality control-banking on busy people not having time to return, fight for refund. Save yourself the aggravation with poor quality product. BTW the original lock that worked no longer works either-tumblers out of synch.
customer_reviews.author: Leanuzza

customer_reviews.title: Yup works great.
customer_reviews.text: Ok full disclosure - we bought 2 in the end. It is a great lock and simple to use - just a combination. However I decided to let my son set the combination, which he did but somehow it was not the one he remembered, so we now have a really good puzzle to try and undo! As it wasn't too expensive and we needed it now so we bought another. If we figure out the combination on the other we will be happy to have 2. Worth the money but beware it really works!! :-/
customer_reviews.author: TKY

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Secure
customer_reviews.text: Looks good but that is far as it goes. The center locking shaft is plastic. Step in the center of the lock, hit it with a rock or pry it with a stick and it will break the locking shaft. No tools required to break this lock open. Spend the few dollar more and get one with at least a metal shaft. This lock will keep an honest person honest and that is about it. How is a breakable plastic lock going to be secure? I sent it back, I hate being ripped off. Amazon needs to drop this product.
customer_reviews.author: brobox

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to use.... BUT too short for many situations. 4' sounds long but remember you have to double over the cable so really it is effectively 2' distance -- even less with real world routing of cable. If you have more than one bike forget it. Only practical for one bike, locked in ideal situation right next to small/medium diameter post directly next to bike frame tube. IMO suggest you get the 6' version unless your application fits the narrow window described. Update: Company sent me a 6' version of this bike cable/lock (for free) which is much more practical for most situations. Kudos for good service. Thanx
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kean

customer_reviews.title: Excelent product !!!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly good. Easy to set up the new combination, is light weight and the most important is rubberized so the bike paint is protected at all the times. And the release bottom is amazing. Just push it and the chain is quickly released. Thanks so much for this product. I am so glad to have it!!! 🌷 Carlos
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Received lock. Got it unlocked per instructions (0000) but ...
customer_reviews.text: Received lock. Got it unlocked per instructions (0000) but had some issues getting it reprogrammed. Somehow I set the code before I wanted to and didn't know what the code was. Simple enough to just insert the key end until it hit a tumbler and then slowing add pressure and turn that tumbler until the key end went in. Only took a few minutes to figure out the code. Once I had that, I was able to follow the instructions and get it coded as I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Gsyk59

customer_reviews.title: Would not come unlocked, had to use bolt cutters to remove it
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: customer service was great and sent me a new lock for free when mine stopped working. I appreciate their help. **** I used this product a few times and thought it was great. Then about a month into using it to keep my bike locked up, it suddenly would not open. I tried the combination multiple times (left and right) but it would not release. This led me to having to use bolt cutters to remove the lock. Big waste of money and has left me lock-less. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Berk

customer_reviews.title: Lock is okay, the mounting piece is trash
customer_reviews.text: Updated: 08-2016 A replacement mount was sent to me for an updated review. The mount looks the same, but I switched out the rubber insert for a thinner one, which should help to reduce the stress on the screw area. Only time will tell. But I will give one more star for customer service. ++++++++++++++ The lock itself is pretty good. However the mounting piece is plastic. The screw broke through the plastic piece completely at installation. It's not well designed. Improvement can be made with washer and longer fastener. The countersunk plastic just have too much stress concentration on it. Perhaps a simple FEA or plastic design calc will help.
customer_reviews.author: Solo C

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed failure
customer_reviews.text: extremely poorly constructed. The tumblers stopped functioning almost immediately. It's almost all light plastic with minimal metal parts -- even the cable is made to *look* wide, but it's only as facade. Cheap, like a toy that will inconvenience you if you treat it as if it's real. You'll be unable to lock your bike up, or unlock it, at some random time. At least it's easy to cut through when it fails. A nice serrated pocket knife could do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfram Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Quality questionable and not thief proof
customer_reviews.text: The first broke by itself after only a few uses— the steel cable literally ripped out of the combination lock, so it wouldn't have even needed to be cut by a thief. Customer service was great, and they replaced it quickly. However, my bike was just recently stolen, and I left it locked up for only an hour in broad daylight on a day where hundreds of people were out in the city. The thief clearly had no issue making fast work. I loved this lock because it was easy to use and lightweight. But after two bad experiences, I no longer can trust it :(
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: With locks I never know what to expect. I've been let down by other locks I've purchased online. Not with this lock. It is very durable and works easily and smoothly. The clip to connect it to my bike is also high quality, but most of all it is easy to operate (adding and removing the lock from the clip). I definitely recommend this bike lock.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P.

customer_reviews.title: A New Use Might
customer_reviews.text: Is exactly what I needed. Believe it or not, non powered walkers can go for over $300, and leaving one unattended and out of you sight when shopping demands a change to a larger basket device is called for. Smaller, lighter, and generally lower in price to some of behemoth systems this thing seems to be made for this use. I know, I know....Who would take advantage of an older or infirmed individual like that? I don’t know, but at $300+ replacement makes me leary of finding out. Specially since the health systems will pay only $75.00 or so.
customer_reviews.author: BoomerEO

customer_reviews.title: Not 12mm
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that the steel portion of the cable is NOT 12mm (1/2"). With the vinyl outer shell it is 12mm. The cable is around 1/4". I like the lock portion...It has a very solid and positive feel when selecting the combo. The plastic storage clip will not last long I don't believe. Its not very substantial. Overall its not a bad lock but I feel I was duped with the cable size. I could have bought a TRUE 12mm cable at the local bike shop for $6 more. UPDATE.....Ushake contacted me and apologized for the misunderstanding and made it right. Great customer service! I changed to 5 stars due to this update.
customer_reviews.author: bakin

customer_reviews.title: Smart Choice!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this lock for our son to use on his bike. The 4-foot-length is perfect as it isn't too bulky, but allows enough room to wrap through the bike and a bike stand (or other) easily. The mount makes it easy to clip on to the bike when not in use and keeps it securely in place. Easy to use and heavy-duty enough to keep would-be thieves at bay.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Starr

customer_reviews.title: Basic lock
customer_reviews.text: Okay, any decent bike thief could break this lock faster than you can read this review; but I still like this lock. I love the lock holder, and the lock cable is long enough to accommodate all kinds of locking situations. The lock was cheap. It's easy to handle. It doesn't get in my way while I'm riding. My bike hasn't been stolen yet. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Love this Lock
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this lock! Easy to turn and read the dials. Easy to set to the combination you choose. Well constructed, nice heavy coated cable, and love that it comes with the piece that attaches to the bike for easy carry and access. Far easier to use than the smaller dial locks I looked at. Price was great as well. Well packaged and delivery was fast! Very happy with this purchase. Will use this seller again for sure. (They even sent me an e-mail to be sure I was happy with the purchase) Great customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Moonminx

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to place in many different areas on your bike, and the combo code is easy to set up and reset if necessary. Bright and colorful, too, to add style to any ride. We bought one for each of our bikes and our electric trikes! Enjoy! (Also, Great Seller! Item as described, timely delivery, would highly recommend buying from them.)
customer_reviews.author: S.I.

customer_reviews.title: It's a simple deterrent that will keep honest people honest.
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive lock to remove an impulse temptation. That's it. A pro will defeat this lock in a second. The fame/saddle tube mount is pretty straight forward.For my needs, it will work fine. It's plastic coated cable will keep the paint from being chipped etc.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waist your money!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waist your money, shell out for a U Lock. My new bike was just stollen, it was locked up with this lock. Took little effort for the thief to cut right through it and walk away with my bike. Hundreds lost in a matter of minutes. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Nice cable, Nice lock.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set the combination to any four digit code that you find easy to remember. Don't you just hate forgetting the combination to a padlock? It is a good sized cable, overkill maybe, and weather proof. Almost worth five starts except that the frame mount isn't anything special... it is plastic and proved to be too small for my seat post without cutting two thirds of the plastic grip/liner off to allow me to get the nuts and bolts close enough to each other that I could screw it together. I think it will hold, we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock !
customer_reviews.text: What a great little lock. I'm going to use it on my recumbent trike which I equipped with an electric pedal assist. Several thousands of $$ at risk. The cable appears very stout and the combination lock is very easy to set. I like the pre-coiled feature and it comes with a push button frame carrier which attaches right behind my seat. The price was "crazy" low and Amazon Prime comes through again. BTW, I wasn't offered or provided any discount or compensation for this review.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Simple bike security cable
customer_reviews.text: The bicycle cable arrived as scheduled. It is easy to set the combination (to whatever you choose). It has mounting hardware to attach to the bike. I've attached mine to the seat post. My only con is the cable is a bit short (as it doesn't want to extend completely). The tradeoff, of course, is a longer cable takes up more space on the bike when not in use. So far, I prefer the cable to a more elaborate U-lock and cable system.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Boncelet

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight bicycle lock.
customer_reviews.text: This lock is great for when you just have to stop somewhere quickly and don't want to just leave your bike unlocked and you are not planning on leaving it alone all day. Using the combination is easier than dealing with or forgetting the key to a lock.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Milburn

customer_reviews.title: Bike stolen first time using this lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock after reading the many great reviews. I took my newly purchased bike out for a spin in the San Francisco Bay Area, and secured it in a well-lit public space with this lock. Came back 5 hours later and my bike is nowhere to be found. Lesson learned: cable locks are VERY easy to cut through. The kryptonite-style U-locks are the only ones worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kugan Kandasamy

customer_reviews.title: I never ever leave any bad reviews, but my bike just got stolen today
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry..I never ever leave any bad reviews, but my bike just got stolen today. It was the second time I've used this lock. The bike disappeared in broad daylight, thanks to this lock. NEW YORK , 2017!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Best bike lock at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike lock! It is easy to use and coils up perfectly under my bike seat for storage (see pic). I really like the way it clamps onto the bike seat post. It easily disconnects from the storage clamp by pushing the button and lifting it up. It is a solid cable and easily uncoils. Best ever I have seen and the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: gm-nc

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bike lock for use at my children's school in a low crime area so it didn't need to be real heavy duty. My 7 year old was practicing locking and unlocking it after we had set it and the number became loose and now it won't hold a combination. We used it 1 time before this. The kids thought it was fun to lock it and then try to guess the code since it was typically only a number or 2 off of the original. Useless lock which is frustrating. Junky product and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Witty

customer_reviews.title: Great for strollers in cities!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike lock so that I could lock my baby's stroller to our front porch (we live in a city with limited space). It was very easy to use and works perfectly for that purpose. I probably wouldn't use it to lock my bike up in an area where lots of bikes get stolen because it seems like it might be able to be cut fairly easily but I could be entirely mistaken about that and it may be unfair for me to say that since I don't really know myself.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel H. Brownell

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the cable style lock and the actual lock and cable here are just fine, exactly what you want... the mounting piece attached to the cable isn't the best though.. it can stress easily when attached to the bracket on your bike.. mine broke which rendered mounting it impossible.. ended up buying a 2nd
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought to lock down my saddle at a community stable. Probably would not stand up to a serous attempt at theft, but prevents others from taking and using my saddle while I'm not there. Combination easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chain, be careful with over tightening
customer_reviews.text: Loved it and hadhad it about a month. When moved to different bike, the brace where the bolt and nuts are sheared on both. Over tightened? I tighten to where it wouldn't move, but guess it was too much. The chain, loved it. The plastic brace, not too durable. Recommend if you want a locking chain, just be careful. Update : the seller sent me a replacement and showed some of the best customer service. So since that is rare, I'm bumping them to 5 stars. If you want a chain for bike, then I highly recommend this one. I love it, but just be careful not to over tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise lock it self is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Bracket holding it on my bike broke on the first few uses. Otherwise lock it self is pretty good. UPDATE: Immediately after writing this review the company that sold and shipped this to me contacted me and sent a replacement right away. I recieved the replacement within 2 days of this review. AWESOME customer service! 5 start A++++
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not super secure. The cable is super thick
customer_reviews.text: Not super secure. The cable is super thick, but the cheap locking mechanism would barely slow anyone with a crowbar from tearing thru it. I use it, but only in places where I plan to leave a bike for minutes, not hours, and definitely not overnight. Would stop a casual thief. But so would a skinnier cable, which would be more compact...
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hocker

customer_reviews.title: My Bike Got Stolen
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened, but the lock obv is easy to cut or easy to pick. Didn't take them long as I wasn't in the store but 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schober

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item. I locked my bike with it just twice before I found it impossible to open again. Its very simple to set & use the combination. Very clear where those numbers are lined up to open it. Anyone can do it. But beware of it because if it wont open your on foot & cutting it off will take time once you get the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ricker

customer_reviews.title: Be careful to not chip your bike frame paint
customer_reviews.text: Works fine to lock bikes. They coil is very stiff. Very difficult to wrap it around bike frame and what ever object you are attaching it to without the coiled cable breaking loose from your hand and chipping the paint on your bike frame. The stiff coil also can make it difficult to align the lock ends. Used it about 12 ti.es and same issues keep reoccurring.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I must say this lock has been awesome. I set the lock combo to a number I use for other things, and the hook thingy is great for holding the lock. I've used it dozens of times and it's still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month...
customer_reviews.text: Not terribly smooth feeling, although it did work for about a month. After a month of daily use, the plastic pieces on each side of the actual lock have come loose and just slide along the cable. These piece are what you pull the lock out with, so with these not attached, it only makes it harder to use a lock that wasn't great to begin with. Would not recommend, nor would I purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Bike Lock
customer_reviews.text: Did not have any issues with using or setting up the lock combination. The length is perfect and gives you plenty of room to wrap around the bike/whatever you are locking it to. Quality seems to be pretty good to. Just like all cheaper locks, if someone really wants to steal your bike they will find a way and be able to get through almost any lock.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Useless. Bike stolen off rack.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: combination lock is simple Cons: literally everything else. It's short, difficult to stretch, and easily broken as evidenced by the fact that I no longer have a bike.
customer_reviews.author: PamC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good length
customer_reviews.text: It’s not short at all. If you use just this you may be able to double it around frame or tire. It seams like it’s sturdy. You get to make up your own combo, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: High quality cable lock at a value price.
customer_reviews.text: The Titanker cable lock is exactly what I was searching for to secure my Electra Townie. I’m confident it will provide me with years of worry free riding. Additionally, the discounted price made it even more appealing
customer_reviews.author: niceinwv

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bike Lock
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bike lock that was thicker and appeared more secure (from potential bike thieves) than my last combo lock. The dials are smoother and the mount is something that makes it easy to attach and forget about it. My issue with bike locks is that most are poorly made and succumb to beach wear with dials that eventually get harder to rotate (I ride my bike to surf nearby). This lock is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Cheap, poorly made, surprisingly difficult to set combination and unlock. This is one of those items on Amazon that either has some sort of deal with the website, or the seller itself is paying work-from-home mommy bloggers to buy it and give it 5 star reviews like so many other "Amazon recommended" items I have bought that turn out to be worthless trash. I'd return it but the cost and effort of returning it outweighs how much I paid for it, so I just threw it in the garbage where it belongs, along with the people who made this piece of crap excuse for a lock.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: ... does what they can to make sure you are happy. After hearing that my original lock got broken ...
customer_reviews.text: This company really cares about customer service and does what they can to make sure you are happy. After hearing that my original lock got broken into and I almost lost my bike, they immediately rectified the issue. This lock works great, I just had a shifty neighborhood
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and nice price point
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my bikes and I have no complaints. Very easy to program to my code of choice. Bracket is slick, secures the cable out if the way, but available when needed. Observation- the bracket is a little small in diameter. My trek shift4 has really thick struts & bars so I had to mount the lock to my steering neck. Seat post would have been ideal but it was too large for the bracket. The lock isn't too long, but perfect for securing the bike frame and front tire to a post or my car bike rack.
customer_reviews.author: GHK

customer_reviews.title: Total Joke, Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Haha, I literally came back to my bike to find this cable cut cleanly off the SECOND time ever using it. It works great as a placebo but if you actually think someone might try and break it don't bother. My bike was stolen the second time leaving it out with this lock. Definitely spend the money on something nice if you're bike is worth more than a couple hundred bucks. Or if you would just like it to be there when you get back.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Insecure, cheap components, and easy to hack
customer_reviews.text: I got my 9 year old son one of these for his new bike so he could ride to school. He set the password, then immediately forgot it. So I was going to just get him a new one, since they're very affordable. I decided I'd try and pick the lock and reset the password. Well, I was surely surprised when it took me all of 30 seconds (!!) to pick this lock with very little instructions from a YouTube video. I have never picked a lock before in my life. If you care about what you're locking up, do do not buy this lock.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: My bycicle got stolen
customer_reviews.text: So I left my bycicle unattended for 30 minutes chained to a post, and I found the lock broke and the chain cut in half, in the middle of the day. DO NOT buy this item
customer_reviews.author: Misael Bazan

customer_reviews.title: easy, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and light weight. not sure how sturdy, I don't think anyone has tried to break it. if you have an extremely nice bike or live/bike somewhere higher risk than me I would opt for something sturdier, it is quite lightweight... good lock for traveling light to the beach, restaurants, etc. maybe a chain lock if you leave your bike out at night..
customer_reviews.author: shelby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Used occasionally. Work fine for 1 year. Then it wouldn’t lock again after opening. first wheel started spinning freely. Won’t lock or unlock now. The cable is a little thin compared to other locks. Makes it easy to use and probably easy to cut through.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kirchner

customer_reviews.title: Maybe their customer service is soooo good that they will send me one
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself works as advertised however when I opened the box there was no bracket for mounting to my bike. The piece of hardware was on the lock cable but no bracket for the bike. To me that was why I purchased the lock. Maybe their customer service is soooo good that they will send me one !!??!! And . . . they did! Great customer service, that's what I'm talking about. They stood by there product and service. I thank you. Looks like good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket Man

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, good value, don't spend more
customer_reviews.text: Here's what I like about this. Thick cable, means business! Nice mount to keep it on/with the bike. Huge NUMBERS in bright white against black. I can read it without my glasses, even in low light. EASY set up to my own combo. I love it, and you probably will too. There were more expensive ones but this one's the best value.
customer_reviews.author: eve Waterhouse

customer_reviews.title: It wouldn't unlock after being left alone over the winter (oct-Jan) and had another issue...
customer_reviews.text: This lock wouldn't allow me to create a code using the number 9 for some reason, I tried everything and the 9 would not work. So I couldn't create the code I wanted to use. Also, this lock was no longer functional after 3 months of having it tied around my bike, as it wasn't being used during the winter. I don't understand how that defect occurred. I had to ask my handyman to cut it off with an electric rotating circular blade. Don't waste your time, get a lock and key or one of the bigger name brand locks.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Broke After One Use
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend used this once: no problem. The second time he notices the first knob is loose and no longer clicks. He locks up the bike: fine. He goes to unlock it: can’t. Combination is correct and everything. He calls me, I bring some metal cutters and a pick, and we sit there and try to turn the notch to get the lock to open: doesn’t work. He resorts to cutting the plastic knob off, then continues to cut through the middle bit until we’re able to finally get it free from the pole. Not encouraging to know it could’ve been that easy for a bike thief.
customer_reviews.author: David Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Set Your Own Combo
customer_reviews.text: It's well made and I like the large numbers on number pad. I wanted this lock so I could set my own combo for locking and unlocking. It fits nicely around bike frame. If I had it to do over I probably would go with the 6 ft length.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great to keep my bicycle safe. I like that no key is needed, just remember the 4-digit code you created.
customer_reviews.author: Vita N

customer_reviews.title: " Works fine now.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two so I could put them together for two bikes. programmed both to the code I wanted. One worked, one didn't. Send e-mail to UShake and got reply the next day saying they couldn't help if it had already been programmed. Did a little playing around with it and found I didn't have the code lined up with the "arrows." Works fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice company
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this lock at first. I purchased almost a year ago, but never used. I just didn't need it until this past weekend. I tried to lock it, but the cable pulled right out of the back side of the locking device. 6-4-2019 - I reached out to the company (and Ivy) helped get me a replacement lock very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: billy

customer_reviews.title: Works great; good price. NOT ok as the only lock overnight, or in a city, though.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good value. Easy to change the combo; seems like it will last well (cheaper cable locks seem to have cylinders that corrode) and the cable is thick enough to slow down a thief. Perfect for an inexpensive bike in a safe area, or to lock the front tire when a u-lock secures the frame to a post in a city.
customer_reviews.author: Rob DC

customer_reviews.title: Have had multiple of these locks break, very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lock last year, and within two weeks of my purchase the lock separated from the cable while I was trying to unlock it from my bike. The seller replaced the original, and now the same thing has happened to the replacement. after looking at the way that this broke, it looks like there is almost nothing holding the cable to the lock mechanism (See the picture). Definitely avoid, this lock supplies no security at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alec B.

product_meta.title: Titanker Bike Lock Cable, 4-Feet Bike Cable Basic Self Coiling Resettable Combination Cable Bike Locks with Complimentary Mounting Bracket, 4 Feet x 1/2 Inch
feature_bullets: Easy to set combination: 4-digit combination locking mechanisms for keyless convenience with a free mounting bracket for easy transportation
Resettable: Easy to set your own personalized number combination
Multipurpose: ideal for bicycles, skateboards, gates & fences, grills & lawnmowers, sports equipment, tool boxes & ladders
Good performance cable: Flexible steel cables for strong cut resistance and PVC coating helps prevent scratching and keeping more durable
Safety Tips: Never leave your bike locked outside for long periods of time. Especially in high crime areas. No bike lock is 100% secure

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
